Study Title: Induction Chemotherapy and Chemoradiotherapy in Nasopharyngeal Cancers
Brief Summary: This is a randomized, multicenter, phase III trial comparing induction chemotherapy with Docetaxel, Cisplatin and 5-Fluorouracil (TPF) followed by concurrent chemoradiotherapy to concurrent chemoradiotherapy alone, in nasopharyngeal cancers staged as T2b, T3, T4 and/or with lymph node involvement (≥ N1. The main end point is the event free survival.
Interventions: PROCEDURE: Induction chemotherapy + concurrent radiochemotherapy vs. concurrent radiochemotherapy
Secondary Outcome Measures: Survival, 3 years|late and acute toxicity according to NCI-CTC and EORTC/RTOG criteria, early and late|Cumulative incidence of loco-regional progression, 3 years|Cumulative rate of metastasis, 3 years|Global response to chemo-radiotherapy, 3 years|Global response to induction chemotherapy, after the induction chemotherapy of the last patient included
Sponsor: Groupe Oncologie Radiotherapie Tete et Cou
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: Hôpital de la Pitié-Salpétrière, Paris, 75013, France|Institut Gustave Roussy, Villejuif, 94805, France|University of Casablanca, Casablanca, Morocco|University of Cluj, Cluj, Romania|Hôpital Habib Bourguiba, Sfax, Tunisia
